y40NRq9yJtztco52-TcuLQ.text: The coconut rice is impressive. Nice grilled chicken and fried vegetable egg noodle. however papaya salad is suggest to avoid

rkJMmhvpOUx96Q8byX3KCw.text: Tried Thai Taste thanks to Yelp & it was amazing!!!! We had the Hawaiian Fried Rice, Pad Thai with Prawns & Fried rice with Prawns & something with chicken that I can't recall. We also had some drinks prior to dinner. Place was super cute & service was great!!! Not expensive for the food quality. Only negative review was the dessert menu nothing we liked!

0Z7-saGvrfa9TZ--pTW21g.text: Good Thai food.  Staff could have been a bit more attentive.  Service was very slow and restaurant was only half full.  Aside from the extremely LOUD, drunk, British 'lady', the atmosphere is very nice for such a small place.  I'd recommend if you're in the area and craving Thai.

Mll7fy_W592ka9Nr5T3ruQ.text: Small, nice place for Thai. Surprisingly modern, upscale ambience but fine for kids (we brought two).

y75_m-qYhbHue19XpWbX3A.text: I love Asian food and eat it frequently. I had not experimented with Thai that much but Thai Taste was highly recommended by the concierge at my hotel. The atmosphere is wonderful, very calm and relaxing. And the food, ugh, it was fantastic! I particularly enjoyed the appetizer of chicken satay..perfection! It's a quaint little place that I would not have heard about unless recommended, but it is more than worth your while!

OCy40UMC6ymJB0ptcHTCQg.text: Had a wonderful meal tonight!  On a cold night it was nice to have hot green tea, chicken in coconut milk soup, and spicy pork stir fried with chilli's and basil! The best coconut chicken soup I have had outside of Asia! The pork was very fatty, that is the only reason for 4 stars and not 5. I highly recommend this restaurant!

8gIzLKbHK92PtTjKsgUu8g.text: I've gone to London for the London Book Fair each year for the past 3 years and each time we have at least one (usually more) dinners at Thai Taste.  In fact, when we plan our dinner meetings, nights out and parties, I ALWAYS say "don't forget about at least one dinner at the Thai place," but we never do forget, so I guess I'm just obnoxious.Anyway, this place is really tiny, a long narrow dining area, with some sort of Thai travel video always playing on the TV, and a wall that's a mirror the full length of the restaurant.  The wine list is small, the beer list is smaller, but the menu is pretty extensive, and the spice options are pretty impressive considering only one chili got my face swelling and made my water disappear instantly.  I've never gone here and NOT ordered the duck spring rolls, they're amazing.  All of the main dishes are big but not obnoviously huge, and the sides are a good size to share, but everything is absolutely delicious.  The only complaint I have about this place is how cramped it is, but almost every restaurant I've been to in the UK is cramped, and very few have food this good.

myD7avtpOTqybHS97HUcDQ.text: Nice and attentive but nothing better than our normal Thai places. Other comment about ambience seems a bit misleading as chairs are nice patio chairs. I guess it is nicer than my experiences in Bangkok, too. Anyway, attentive and nice staff. Karaoke downstairs if interested.

dgB324oC3WqqWfbSg8j8YQ.text: Great Restaurant, music, and overall environment. Love their panang beef, nothing short of delicious.

_OE83iMgZ42zCICB7RSgTQ.text: The food was good, but, wow, the service and the attitude - awful! this place in California would be out of business in a week.

b-sb8ygW3mXQlLylxVvlHQ.text: Love the yellow curry with chicken, potatoes and onions. My husband loves their red curry with chicken and bamboo shoots (a little spicier) and my friend really likes their pad thai. Prompt service, small space but never crowded. The decor is simple and elegant. We've always been seated right away and the food comes out quickly. We're in and out of there in no time. And the prices are reasonable. They bring out a bowl of fish flavored pork rinds before the meal (a little fishy for my taste!), and at the end the bring some mints with the check. We first tried this place after checking yelp for high rated thai places near our flat in South Kensington. We far prefer Thai Taste to Thai Square down the road. Thai Taste has better food and better service.

pg9yaye9UehWdj6jnPbDag.text: I am a bit obsessed with Thai food. I would eat it everyday if I could. So I yelped this place and decided to give it a go last night. I liked it so much I went back and had the same meal tonight... Here's the price rundown:1 CUP Tom yum soup (with 4 large shrimp) 5.951 single portion mussaman chicken 9.951 scoop steamed rice (NOT jasmine) 2.201 glass diet coke 2.50So that totals £20.60 and they add a service charge of £2.58£23.18 is steep for a Thai dinner for 1.No leftovers.$36.00 It was delicious. Deeeee-licous!!!The flavor of the Tom yum was not 100% authentic but it was really great. The rice is standard steamed white... Why does it cost extra?????The chicken in the curry and the actual curry gravy was so damn good it was all I could do to refrain from licking the bowl. Dammnnnnnn good!But still, restaurants are expensive here in London and I guess it was good enough to be a good experience. I would have been pissed if the food was not so good.I really want to go again tomorrow but I just can't expense such an expensive meal again. If the prices don't freak you out, give it a go.It's a nice little space but not really fancy or anything... Just a typical modern space.Lots of good food in London, for sure... Have fun!

QG7z4otwjP_SrxQx0Oquhg.text: I tried this place out last night with a friend. The food is really good. I had the green curry with tofu. The curry sauce was wonderful - spicy, sweet. The tofu is fried and cut into really big pieces. They were a little cumbersome to eat. We started with some corn cakes, which at first seemed a little odd at a Thai restaurant. They were tasty, though. All in all, a great place.

F081yL-P3ps6V54A35GB0Q.text: While I was living in  London last fall. This place was really close to my flat, and I always came here after class for lunch. The service is really good and the waitresses are really friendly.

wRmbykOwEfgSTVu72CkbYA.text: Excellent, relaxing place for a nice dinner. Outstanding, friendly service. I had the yellow chicken curry and it was great. The lemongrass tea is worth a visit by itself.

aevypdKvni6wFDe0IkyaYg.text: We were out with kids looking for a Thai meal in day worn casual gear. This was the answer. Felt comfortable in casual attire but could equally have been out for the night. Food was really good especially the red curry. A great mix of appetisers and a good fill of main courses with moderate drinking came in at £20 a head. Excellent. Also vodka tonic only £3  singha only £2.75.

kYCkO-rkeAFSpUyGp_J2Vw.text: Had dinner here during my stay in London.  It's just down the road from our hotel (Kensington Close) and near a small stretch of boutiques on Kensington Road.  The staff was very friendly and prompt. I was a bit disappointed that they didn't have "Thai Iced Tea" which was a favorite drink of mine in Phuket, and because of the condensed milk, would've made a nice cooler after eating spicy food.  I tried the coconut chicken soup, the panang curry, steamed rice, spicy basil beef salad, and steamed bass.  All were well prepared and fresh.  The panang curry was especially tasty!  Surprisingly authentic food (I discovered that most of the employees are from Mongolia/China) and although a bit pricy for thai food, still a good bargain relative to other restaurants in the area.  If you're in the mood for a tasty adventure, then you need to try it!  Enjoy!

L5VQLuWhMVbycS-qSb4a5w.text: This is an absolutely wonderful Thai dining experience just a short walk from the Glouster Road station.  The dining area is small and a bit compact and could be a little cramped at times, but once your meal is served you will completely forget about that.  The food itself is wonderfully prepared and presented promptly.  The waitresses were very efficient and you never have to wait for anything.  The food was probably the best Thai I've had in London and indeed bests my favorite Thai places in the US as well.  Can't recommend this place highly enough!

r965ZViRr_OkKmv5iS0TTw.text: Really pedestrian food with indifferent service. I was expecting much more. Every dish we had was unremarkable. In a restaurant that seats 32, we still had to hail someone down for drinks and rice. We will not be back.

jVVJo4l9UvicslLQKO9ukQ.text: Excellent food here. Rivals the Thai food in HawaiiReally , really good. Great service and excellent presentation.

-Rp7AWoyPlFBNGl-yuid5g.text: My wife and I traveled to London for a week from New York and had our dinner here.We ordered the yellow curry, pad see ew as main course and fish cake, dumpling as appetizer.The space is ok, clean and seats are comfort but just little too tight. Foods are ok, I say it's little above average because we tried so many good Thai restaurants in New York and in Thailand. Not too impressive about the taste.The service is average as well , the lady who served us just did her job.Overall, this restaurant provided what we expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. As expected, no free water
Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Dumpling, little too flat
Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Fish cake

u5eJ23Pg6bG3W40ZXtMnxQ.text: Had the green curry with brown rice. Only minus is that I needed to pay for the rice, isn't that usually included when you order Thai dishes? Cosy place, but since I was in a hurry the take away option was not a problem. Quick delivering, perfect spiced. Thank you :)

SCuMRIkSmwwExD037bk4SQ.text: Delicious Thai food. Probably the best Pad Thai and Pad See Ew with tofu I've had. Perfect tempura vegetables. Cozy place with friendly staff. Great location.

31mWlItUujzztzAi307r_g.text: Tasty and definitely satisfies the thai-craving but not really a destination.

dQIFoG8r2NixPbaL01yPAg.text: I found this place on Yelp, and as we needed a restaurant near our hotel we decided to try it out. I'm very glad we did.My partner and I enjoyed a tasty 'Crispy pork-filled wonton' appetizer, which wasn't quite like anything we've had before.Mains consisted of Pad Kee Mao (similar to Chicken Pad Thai) and Sizzling Beef. Both were beautifully presented, delicious and satisfying.If you're contemplating a visit to Thai Taste I can say that the food is delicious, ambience trendy and relaxing, and staff friendly. If I have one small criticism it would be the amount of time we had to wait for the bill. Other than that small issue our experience was wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Pad Kee Mao (similar to Chicken Pad Thai) and Sizzling Beef in the foreground.
Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Crispy pork filled wonton appetizer.

gOnzv9QluFZbda5VBp8LwQ.text: We were staying at a hotel on Cromwell Road.With the help of Yelp, we found this small eatery.Service was friendly and efficient.  It seems to be a popular place for locals and tourists alike.Food was a-ok.  Maybe we should have ordered the "popular" dishes?No warm and fuzzies on this first visit...maybe the next visit?Uhm, I don't think I will be in their neck of the woods for a long while.Seeing that London is a very far commute from LA.

5myijNPrt8aMUJA19mPlcw.text: I arrived outside of rush hour and it showed.  Service was fast, pleasant and accurate in their order taking. My beer arrived quickly along with free prawn / fish crackers. The Tom Yam Goong was spicy and very authentic in taste as well as ingredients. My Pad Thai had been left sittling for a little while so the noodles were sticking together more than normal but the flavour was still excellent. The sticky rice with mango was good but the rice was a little too dry for me to say it was a perfect sticky rice dessert. However, overall, I was very happy with my meal and its tastes. Soup, pad thai, dessert and two beers for under £35.Would definitely return to this little gem.

-4ywLueKOKGdKfUMrqAZUg.text: Checked this place out on a evening I wanted to have a quick dinner. In that regard it was living up to its expectations. I ordered within 5 minutes and was served the first dish in Max 15, finished of in 35min.The interior is young a d bright, with jazzy music in the background creating a nice atmosphere. Staff are friendly, but that's it.The presentation of the food doesn't live up to the vibe in the restaurant. It's old fashioned and cliché Asian with lots of salad and the odd carrots shaped in flowers...The grilled squid was bland, but the dressing was excellent. The beef salads sauce was as spicy as promised but the meat was dry and chewy.The main weeping tiger, a beef dish with tamarind sauce, was with OK meat, however it came with vegetables that were so tasteless that I start wondering whether they were for decoration as well. The sauce was of the right sweetness. Overall a soso experience.

z6HCvHOKiYezNqcEJ7gyNA.text: The yellow curry with coconut milk is the best curry I have ever had! Everything was delicious and warm. The mango with sweet sticky rice was phenomenal. I will recommend this to anyone I know coming to London! One of the best meals I've had in London to date.

YG0RI0OjrZgryoqXueuZgA.text: Food was greatAmbiance seemed high end for ThaiService was goodTruly enjoyable mealI walked past Thai Taste with my husband and thought it looked too fancy to be a decent Thai restaurant. We had just come back from Thailand no less than 3 months ago for our honeymoon so I was a bit skeptical. Low and behold a pretty awesome and tasty Panang curry! It was great. I seriously ate that plate of curry like it was my last meal. And for such a swanky looking place it was the best prices on the row of restaurants. go figure. I'll probably be going back tonight actually. That good!

lEeQ5nRvtxTatUSAeHAsLA.text: the yellow curry had a really good flavor, but my husband's (beef and veggies on rice) meal was just ok. you can choose the kind of rice you want (coconut...yum), but you are charged for that in additional to your meal.it was about $60 for two entrees and drinks...WOW!

0xqXT6KnJouTgxIWfcc7Jw.text: We found this little gem and it is nicely decorated and a great use of a small space. Very clean and a great locstion for us. We had the chicken satay and green curry, both delicious! Our server was very knowledgeable and helped up choose which curry we would like the best. We will definitely be going back to this restaurant.

zr501Y3Hk_8zfVyC9EzboQ.text: We happened upon Thai Taste on our first (rainy) night in London. The restaurant is small, but very clean and modern. I opted for the Chicken Pad Thai, while my husband tried a Chicken Curry dish. Both were fantastic! We thought prices were reasonable and service was good. Thai Taste comes recommended by me!

m_-SDzgVQgH__HpTThBntw.text: Very pleasant restaurant reasonably priced and nice food would definitely returnNot a very big venue so may pay to book if you are keen and the rest rooms were very clean

HgWwt6gDVQewMqVvJk4cEw.text: Every dish we had was very good and nicely served:- Chicken satay- Red curry (both duck and chicken)Nice atmosphere and good service for an affordable price.

_k6L8bIXiYE52A9cAUYbqQ.text: This is a quick block from our hotel, Marriott. We found it via a review in yelp. It did not disappoint. The restaurant was full at 9pm Monday evening. They made up a table in loft area in back - very lovely. We had our 9 and 12 year olds with us. We skipped appetizer and went straight for dinner. My husband saw a dish pass by that was too hot for another customer - stopped to find out what it was - it was on the chefs recommendation page with green curry. He ordered that. We also had panang curry, sweet and sour chicken and pad see ew. The pad see ew was the best we had ever had and our daughter always orders it. It was delicious! The panang and sweet/sour did not disappoint and the green curry was scrumptious with some heat. We ordered additional coconut rice because everyone chowed down on their own plates and ate off each other's. There was not a bit left. Quite possibly our best meal all trip! What a wonderful spot to eat and chic place to socialize. We will definitely be back this week!!

3QJf7OudQKLDCuCEmZcwUA.text: My partner and I went here over Easter and were really impressed with the Food,service and the prices. The Duck curry was a highlight as well as the mixed starter for two. Would highly recommend this quaint little restaurant.

31cO6kFDudNHSyIwZQN2Cg.text: Yelpers in the UK really have yet to let me down.I saw all the good reviews for Thai Taste, and so I obviously had to stop by while staying down the street. I had a fantastic meal at this surprisingly intimate restaurant. I started with an order of the chicken satay. The chicken was cooked perfectly and the peanut sauce on the side was awesome. I ordered the "Weeping Tiger" special -- grilled sirloin steak with tamarind and a plum sugar sauce -- as my entree. Again, the meat was cooked to perfection. Something in the sauce didn't really agree with me -- still not sure what it was -- but the whole meal was still great.I'm a big tea buff, so I was absolutely smitten with their lemongrass tea. I drank an entire pot on my own, and probably could've ordered a second one had I not pulled myself away from the table. Definitely a winner.

pdjpn9n7OKkzxHVv32C1Jw.text: Great food - very authentic and very tasty. The cost is also very reasonable for London. The only downside is that the interior is very small (seats about 20 people) and somewhat dull. But if ambiance is irrelevant then this is a great place for dinner.

6bZMH6CVpo4UvvbKx88hVg.text: We were staying here in London and decided to get some Thai food.  We had seen this down the road from where we stayed.  We decided to give it a go.  It had been a busy day, so we opted for an appetizer as well as a dinner.  We both ordered Satay Chicken for an appetizer.  It was excellent.  My wife is gluten free and they made ours that way.I ordered the Chili chow Sea Bass.  It is a curry dish that had a little heat.  It was tasty and perfectly cooked.  The stir fried egg rice was outstanding compliment to the fish.  My wife ordered the Pad Thai Chicken that was prepared for her gluten free.  It was yummy.  Bill's wife ordered the Pad Thai with Prawns.  She said that it could have been a little spicier, but was extremely satisfied.  Bill ordered the Gai Phad Manuang Chicken.  He said that it was tasty, but needed more chili's. This dish is served over egg fried rice.  The server brought the extra chili's and the dish was top notch.  This is a very good option for those seeking a Thai dish on the west side of London.

tikObit-umXYrvTApWQ7vw.text: Enjoyed my dinner at Thai Taste. Ordered the coconut rice, which was a nice change from jasmine. Any rice is ala carte which is ridiculous and drops my rating. Most other Thai Restaurants would have offered tofu as an option for all the dishes, increasing the vegetarian options, Which Thai Taste does not. I ordered the stir fried prawns with asparagus. Which was tasty. Service was good and this small restaurant was bustling. You need to make a reservation to ensure you can get a table.

T8aZOS_Acb-Db5qwyzzL4Q.text: This place was really good. Great fried rice and green curry. Definetly one of the best and most authentic Thai food I have had in a long time!

bUmvsSaAy5_rV1DruvYrDA.text: I have been here  4-5 times over the years  & this place is consistently good! The service is good the food is always good !! I was just here with a group of friends & everyone was happy with their food. The yellow curry is always good!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Vegetable tempura with chicken satay,
Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Yellow curry medium heat

yUwmxAA2bo7D1835ZtMBHw.text: A friendly local neighborhood restaurant with some pretty great food and an attentive staff.At first I was a bit nervous about being led down to the basement. I didn't have a reservation and they were rather busy for a Wednesday evening. Think 70's Lounge with dim mood lighting, that's what it looked like but it was actually kind of cozy and although not as upscale as the upstairs dining room it didn't detract from the meal.The black pepper calamari was excellent, really excellent and a good portion. The accompanying jasmine rice was a nice side. However, I wouldn't order the appetizer of dim sim again. It was a bit bland and lacked spice or salt. Service was friendly and efficient.Overall, this was definitely a "visit again" type of restaurant. Reservations suggested.

MGsJy-VmQvAjkYUNLpG9rw.text: Excellent food. You can't go wrong. We had Panang curry and Seabass. The food was great. What can I say, you should come and check it out.We didn't have the Satay, but we did have the roasted duck rolls. They were not as good as I hoped. However, all the other dishes were excellent! Service also was great!Come check it out. You will not be disappointed...

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom

HTB-JnESPfAmcHxsT3Quvg.text: My mom and I were staying in a nearby hotel and were trying some of the local restaurants around. We stumbled upon this place, and I'm sure glad we did!The food was so great that we ended up eating here twice in one week. Not only was the food fantastic, but the service was also amazing.We didn't make a reservation on a particularly busy night, but KC managed to fit us in! We were so grateful.Definitely will be recommending this to other friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Dessert menu

fJGA9GbIaqidphKzILeeNQ.text: Stopped in to put in my to go order. Ordered green curry and Pad kee mao + tofu from the vegetarian menu.  I stopped by Sainsbury during to pick up a few things while waiting and my order was ready a few minutes after i returned.Spice level is nice. Spicy is indicated on the menu. I liked how the vegetables were crunchy and fresh instead of being over cooked. I noticed every Thai place is a bit different when it comes to flavor and this spot was legit in my opinion. I would def order from here again in the future

dpmqqgn-8z8XxZ3ZsRMoeQ.text: Ah-ma-zing. So much that we ate here thrice in 3 days!We arrived to London - 3 hungry hippos who just got off the train from Brussels - and were desperate for food. We quickly yelped the area in which we were staying in and saw that this place received pretty good ratings.  We quickly left the door (not giving 2 rats about our appearance) and quickly bolted across the street.  The restaurant was a lot more glam than we thought (we were picturing a casual Thai resto) but were greeted with fine white table cloths in an elegant setting.  Since we were going to have dinner a couple hours later and only needed something quick to settle our stomachs, we only order a pad thai and a thai beef salad.  The food was quickly prepared (it was dead given that it was about 3-4pm on a weekday, I think) and needless to say, it was scarfed down in seconds.  The pad thai oozed with authentic-ness- flavours (no ketchup!) and was perfectly prepared. We went back the day after (and the day after that prior to departing home) and had 2 more meals here. Everything was so friggen tasty - definitely one of the best thai meals we've ever had.  Even the Lemongrass Tea that my sister ordered was incredible - oozing with and infused with a pure, aromatic, strong lemongrass flavour (we were told the tea was imported from Thailand). You bet we'll be back next time we're in London! Only downside: the portions are tinier than usual.P.S Their coconut rice is to-die-for!!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Gorgeous presentation and even better flavours!! And the coconut rice is to die for!

EGcoHrfNGDEN4BqQ18J5sg.text: Second time here, first time for dinner.  This place is always packed for dinner and i can see why.  The food is well prepared, properly spiced and includes some classic Thai items.  Some of the standard items were excellently executed in fact and we would point out the chicken satays, while pedestrian, were tender and came with fabulous dipping sauces.  We had the soft shell crab which was a daily special, very good, but in my opinion, needs some heat.  To finish, i would recommend the mango and sticky rice, a classic way to finish a meal.  We'd go again for sure.

KegHaIuJjEPgxM3O2ipphg.text: Excellent foodA big 0 on serviceWas horrible Waited 30 minutes for our check and they never cleared our tableThey need more staff

FVhOFdG7FIxZ-5cRC7xQcQ.text: Quite possibly the best meals, yes meals during my stay in London. I enjoyed it so much I made a second visit the very next day. Service was exceptional even though they were packed full of guesses. The food was delicious. A nice change of taste after days of very bland foods. Kudos to the chefs!

C64St2xqnswP0BNbqimieg.text: We were there last night for dinner and had wonderful Thai food. Highly recommend. Enjoy!

-hTNMP1xiyNp4ecYulTBpA.text: We have had dinner at Thai Taste twice over the past two weeks.  The food, the service and the ambience are all outstanding.  It is a small, intimate place with about 12-14 tables, very nicely appointed. I don't often write reviews.  If you enjoy Thai cuisine, this is a must.  Try it.

532DUSO4qUxG5usBDRzO_A.text: Nice place to grab dinner. Lacks decor but makes up for it with classic Thai dishes. Good for tourists looking for somewhere near their hotels. Green curry was good. So was the Thai tea. I made a reservation but it didn't seem busy.

JbgVtXHbbZqlqX5obWZkrg.text: I'm not a fan of Thai food but tonight at Thai Taste I was. I came in here on accident, my intent was to visit the Italian restaurant next door, when I saw that it was empty I quickly jumped on yelp in hopes for an explanation and sure enough the one and a half star was all I needed to walk away. The next closest place was Thai taste and in this sort of cold, I did not want to walk another block. The place is small but the tables were just about all taken, good sign that nudged me into checking it out but it was pure laziness (or fate) that was the deciding factor and made me walk in to get some food in my belly and to thaw out my toes. I was quickly greeted by a man who was clearly not Thai but had a smile that said otherwise. I was seated and menus brought to me immediately. I like that they had a wine list as well, although it was a short wine list, it had a nice selection. I went easy and ordered the chicken fried rice and the chicken and ginger- Basil (sorry these were called something else on the menu but that was the description). I know I played it safe on my selection but if they can't do simple dishes like that right then they certainly couldn't handle much else.  Here's where I would throw in a bunch of superlative's but I won't and I'll just say that the food was outstanding, so much that I text the beastie who was in another country just to say so and fish for a reaction to what surely would be disbelief on his part. Wonderful staff,Great service, warm smile's and fantastic, fresh, perfectly prepared food. I still wouldn't call myself a Thai food fan but again, I am a fan of Thai Taste. Well done!

5qmYux18hkuG6663h3e3IQ.text: Everything is perfect! Especially the Spare pork ribs and banana toffee tart! And the environment is just comfortable. Love love love!

ZwvSlHE5CpudBAUiU9-Wvg.text: I visited this place while in London on business. It was Saturday at lunch. The food was fantastic. When they say it's spicy, it really is spicy unlike other restaurants with "spicy" foods that really aren't.It's clean and nicely decorated. I had a great dining experience.

wo8FmRwzH0tWXy8HcBDzjw.text: I stayed nearby at the Marriott and ate here daily.  Dinner was crowded but service was attentive and polite. Lunch was quiet with quick service.  Always with a smile.  The food is fresh, delicious, and portions are relatively generous.  The dim sum starter is great. There are four shiu Mai dumplings with roasted garlic on top.  The spring rolls were just ok.  The tom young soup was good but expensive for a small portion.  The mains consisted of the soft shell curry crab.  A must try!!!!  The steamed sea bass was perfect.  Light and fresh with hints of lemongrass and citrus.  I would come back in a minute.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Soft shell crab curry.  Sooooooo goood.
Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Thai dim sum and spring rolls.  Spring rolls were just ok.  Dim sum was fantastic.
Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Steamed sea bass with egg fried rice.  Very fresh and tasty.

T-LJ4F39LeiaPRhgSBj8zw.text: Nice place packed on a Saturday evening.  They have additional seating downstairs but didn't get a chance to see it. Service was quick as was delivery of the food. Hostess and waitresses were quick to seat and serve. Good casual dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Taste - London, United Kingdom. Pad Kee Mao accompanied with a glass of Malbec
